trans-unit.source: The three-server SharePoint farm Resource Manager template
trans-unit.target: The three-server SharePoint farm Resource Manager template

trans-unit.source: Step through the structure of the Azure Resource Manager template for the three-server SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: Step through the structure of the Azure Resource Manager template for the three-server SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: The three-server SharePoint farm Resource Manager template
trans-unit.target: The three-server SharePoint farm Resource Manager template

trans-unit.source: This topic steps you through the structure of the azuredeploy.json template file for the three-server SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: This topic steps you through the structure of the azuredeploy.json template file for the three-server SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: You can see the contents of this template in your browser from [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/master/sharepoint-three-vm/azuredeploy.json).
trans-unit.target: You can see the contents of this template in your browser from [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/master/sharepoint-three-vm/azuredeploy.json).

trans-unit.source: Alternately, to examine a local copy of the azuredeploy.json file, designate a local folder as the location for the file, and then create it (for example, C:\Azure\Templates\SharePointFarm).
trans-unit.target: Alternately, to examine a local copy of the azuredeploy.json file, designate a local folder as the location for the file, and then create it (for example, C:\Azure\Templates\SharePointFarm).

trans-unit.source: Fill in the folder name and run these commands at the Azure PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the folder name and run these commands at the Azure PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Open the azuredeploy.json template in a text editor or tool of your choice.
trans-unit.target: Open the azuredeploy.json template in a text editor or tool of your choice.

trans-unit.source: The following describes the structure of the template file and the purpose of each section.
trans-unit.target: The following describes the structure of the template file and the purpose of each section.

trans-unit.source: "parameters" section
trans-unit.target: "parameters" section

trans-unit.source: The **"parameters"** section specifies parameters that are used to input data into a template.
trans-unit.target: The **"parameters"** section specifies parameters that are used to input data into a template.

trans-unit.source: You must supply the data when the template is executed.
trans-unit.target: You must supply the data when the template is executed.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 50 parameters can be defined.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 50 parameters can be defined.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of a parameter for the Azure location:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of a parameter for the Azure location:

trans-unit.source: "variables" section
trans-unit.target: "variables" section

trans-unit.source: The **"variables"** section specifies variables and their values that the template uses.
trans-unit.target: The **"variables"** section specifies variables and their values that the template uses.

trans-unit.source: Variable values can be explicitly set or be derived from parameter values.
trans-unit.target: Variable values can be explicitly set or be derived from parameter values.

trans-unit.source: In contrast to parameters, you do not supply them when you execute the template.
trans-unit.target: In contrast to parameters, you do not supply them when you execute the template.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 100 variables can be defined.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 100 variables can be defined.

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples:
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples:

trans-unit.source: "resources" section
trans-unit.target: "resources" section

trans-unit.source: The **"resources"** section specifies information that is needed to deploy the resources for the SharePoint farm in a resource group.
trans-unit.target: The **"resources"** section specifies information that is needed to deploy the resources for the SharePoint farm in a resource group.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 250 resources can be defined, and resource dependencies can only be defined 5 levels deep.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 250 resources can be defined, and resource dependencies can only be defined 5 levels deep.

trans-unit.source: This section contains the following subsections:
trans-unit.target: This section contains the following subsections:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts

trans-unit.source: This section creates a new storage account for all VHD and disk resources for the farm.
trans-unit.target: This section creates a new storage account for all VHD and disk resources for the farm.

trans-unit.source: Here is the JSON code for the storage account:
trans-unit.target: Here is the JSON code for the storage account:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Network/publicIPAddresses
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Network/publicIPAddresses

trans-unit.source: These sections create a set of public IP addresses through which each virtual machine can be reached over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: These sections create a set of public IP addresses through which each virtual machine can be reached over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Compute/availabilitySets
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Compute/availabilitySets

trans-unit.source: These sections create three availability sets, one for each tier of the deployment:
trans-unit.target: These sections create three availability sets, one for each tier of the deployment:

trans-unit.source: Active Directory domain controllers
trans-unit.target: Active Directory domain controllers

trans-unit.source: SQL Server cluster
trans-unit.target: SQL Server cluster

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Servers
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Servers

trans-unit.source: Here is an example:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks

trans-unit.source: These sections create a cloud-only virtual network with three subnets (one for each tier of the deployment), into which the virtual machines are placed.
trans-unit.target: These sections create a cloud-only virtual network with three subnets (one for each tier of the deployment), into which the virtual machines are placed.

trans-unit.source: Here is the JSON code:
trans-unit.target: Here is the JSON code:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Network/loadBalancers
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Network/loadBalancers

trans-unit.source: These sections create load balancer instances for each virtual machine to provide Network Address Translation (NAT) and traffic filtering for inbound traffic from the Internet.
trans-unit.target: These sections create load balancer instances for each virtual machine to provide Network Address Translation (NAT) and traffic filtering for inbound traffic from the Internet.

trans-unit.source: For each load balancer, settings configure the front end, the back end, and inbound NAT rules.
trans-unit.target: For each load balancer, settings configure the front end, the back end, and inbound NAT rules.

trans-unit.source: For example, there are Remote Desktop traffic rules for each virtual machine and, for the SharePoint Server, a rule to allow inbound web traffic (TCP port 80) from the Internet.
trans-unit.target: For example, there are Remote Desktop traffic rules for each virtual machine and, for the SharePoint Server, a rule to allow inbound web traffic (TCP port 80) from the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Here is the example for the SharePoint Server:
trans-unit.target: Here is the example for the SharePoint Server:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Network/networkInterfaces
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Network/networkInterfaces

trans-unit.source: These sections create one network interface for each virtual machine and configure a static IP address for the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: These sections create one network interface for each virtual machine and configure a static IP address for the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: Here is the example for the network interface of the domain controller:
trans-unit.target: Here is the example for the network interface of the domain controller:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines

trans-unit.source: These sections create and configure the three virtual machines in the deployment.
trans-unit.target: These sections create and configure the three virtual machines in the deployment.

trans-unit.source: The first section creates and configures the domain controller, which:
trans-unit.target: The first section creates and configures the domain controller, which:

trans-unit.source: Specifies the storage account, availability set, network interface, and load balancer instance.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the storage account, availability set, network interface, and load balancer instance.

trans-unit.source: Adds an extra disk.
trans-unit.target: Adds an extra disk.

trans-unit.source: Runs a PowerShell script to configure the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: Runs a PowerShell script to configure the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: Here is the JSON code:
trans-unit.target: Here is the JSON code:

trans-unit.source: An additional section for the domain controller starting with **"name": "UpdateVNetDNS"** configures the DNS server of the virtual network to use the static IP address of the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: An additional section for the domain controller starting with **"name": "UpdateVNetDNS"** configures the DNS server of the virtual network to use the static IP address of the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: The next **"type": "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines"** section creates the SQL Server virtual machines in the deployment and:
trans-unit.target: The next **"type": "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines"** section creates the SQL Server virtual machines in the deployment and:

trans-unit.source: Specifies the storage account, availability set, load balancer, virtual network, and network interface.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the storage account, availability set, load balancer, virtual network, and network interface.

trans-unit.source: Adds an extra disk.
trans-unit.target: Adds an extra disk.

trans-unit.source: Additional **"Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/extensions"** sections call the PowerShell script to configure the SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Additional **"Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/extensions"** sections call the PowerShell script to configure the SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: The next **"type": "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines"** section creates the SharePoint virtual machine in the deployment, specifying the storage account, availability set, load balancer, virtual network, and network interface.
trans-unit.target: The next **"type": "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines"** section creates the SharePoint virtual machine in the deployment, specifying the storage account, availability set, load balancer, virtual network, and network interface.

trans-unit.source: An additional **"Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/extensions"** section calls a PowerShell script to configure the SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: An additional **"Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/extensions"** section calls a PowerShell script to configure the SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: Note the overall organization of the subsections of the **"resources"** section of the JSON file:
trans-unit.target: Note the overall organization of the subsections of the **"resources"** section of the JSON file:

trans-unit.source: Create the elements of Azure infrastructure that are required for supporting multiple virtual machines (a storage account, public IP addresses, availability sets, a virtual network, network interfaces, and load balancer instances).
trans-unit.target: Create the elements of Azure infrastructure that are required for supporting multiple virtual machines (a storage account, public IP addresses, availability sets, a virtual network, network interfaces, and load balancer instances).

trans-unit.source: Create the domain controller virtual machine, which uses the previously created common and specific elements of Azure infrastructure, adds a data disk, and runs a PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: Create the domain controller virtual machine, which uses the previously created common and specific elements of Azure infrastructure, adds a data disk, and runs a PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, update the virtual network to use the static IP address of the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, update the virtual network to use the static IP address of the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: Create the SQL Server virtual machine, which uses the previously created common and specific elements of the Azure infrastructure created for the domain controller, adds data disks, and runs a PowerShell script to configure the SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Create the SQL Server virtual machine, which uses the previously created common and specific elements of the Azure infrastructure created for the domain controller, adds data disks, and runs a PowerShell script to configure the SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Create the SharePoint Server virtual machine, which uses the previously created common and specific elements of the Azure infrastructure and runs a PowerShell script to configure the SharePoint farm.
trans-unit.target: Create the SharePoint Server virtual machine, which uses the previously created common and specific elements of the Azure infrastructure and runs a PowerShell script to configure the SharePoint farm.

trans-unit.source: Your own JSON template to build a multi-tier infrastructure in Azure should follow the same steps:
trans-unit.target: Your own JSON template to build a multi-tier infrastructure in Azure should follow the same steps:

trans-unit.source: Create the common (storage account, virtual network), tier-specific (availability sets), and virtual machine-specific (public IP addresses, availability sets, network interfaces, load balancer instances) elements of Azure infrastructure that are required for your deployment.
trans-unit.target: Create the common (storage account, virtual network), tier-specific (availability sets), and virtual machine-specific (public IP addresses, availability sets, network interfaces, load balancer instances) elements of Azure infrastructure that are required for your deployment.

trans-unit.source: For each tier in your application (such as authentication, database, web), create and configure the servers in that tier using the common (storage account, virtual network), tier-specific (availability set) and virtual machine-specific (public IP addresses, network interfaces, load balancer instances) elements.
trans-unit.target: For each tier in your application (such as authentication, database, web), create and configure the servers in that tier using the common (storage account, virtual network), tier-specific (availability set) and virtual machine-specific (public IP addresses, network interfaces, load balancer instances) elements.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager template language](../resource-group-authoring-templates.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager template language](../resource-group-authoring-templates.md).
